direction.raw_text: ON a pair of hands from VARIOUS ANGLES... The SOUNDS of the fighting grow LOUDER. Punches, kicks, elbows... The hands tense into fists. They're strong hands. Fighter's hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: OUT TO REVEAL Julian (mid-thirties) staring at his hands. Even though he's kept in shape, he hasn't fought for a long time. The SOUND of the boxing match gets LOUDER STILL as Julian continues staring at his hands - it's almost as if he's meditating. Suddenly he breaths in. Behind him sits a young kid dressed in Thai boxing clothes - this is Liang, barely sixteen. He looks nervous, occasionally glancing at Julian's reflection through the huge mirror that hangs on the far wall. Julian continues to stare at his hands and closes them into a tight fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SOUNDS of the boxing match reach FEVER PITCH as we TRACK WITH Julian and Liang making their way towards the ring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two Young Thai Boxers beat the crap out of each other. The crowd is wild with excitement, people placing bets on which way the fight will turn. One of the Thai Boxers goes down and money immediately starts changing hands... The ring is cleared and Liang jumps in as Julian pushes his way though the crowd, nodding at people as he passes. They know him here. Again bets are placed....

direction.raw_text: a face in the crowd. Billy. Julian's older brother (late thirties). Julian sits down next to Billy who's delighted to see him, throwing his arm around him, pulling him in close.

direction.raw_text: ... I love violence! Billy offers Julian a hit from his bottle of Mehkong whiskey. Julian refuses. He's more interested in the fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: where the fight has just started. Liang is immediately on the ropes. Julian watches, concerned. Billy takes a phone call but he can't hear. He nods to Julian and takes it outside.

direction.raw_text: where Liang pulls an amazing move. Turns the tables. Takes the bigger man down with a series of jabs, swings and backfists. As Julian applauds Liang's success, Billy slinks off out of the auditorium. Liang wins the fight with a knock out... The crowd go wild with adulation... Julian watches, transfixed... Liang is lit up by a beatific white light... As he stands triumphant in the middle of the ring, the crowd start to gather round him... Julian continues to stare at what's taking place before him... ... Which is almost like a religious ceremony... The audience bow down before Liang as he stares out into the light... A look of calm washing over his face... A sense of stillness and peace... Enlightenment through victory and violence...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy stalks the streets of the city of vice. A man on a mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liang is sitting on a bench, his constantly-smiling Mother beside him, as Julian peels off fifty Bhat notes. We get the sense that Julian's proud of him, that Liang is something of a protege of his and that Liang is incredibly pleased to have gained his approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two fifty, three hundred... Liang takes the money. Julian pulls off two more notes. A bonus.

direction.raw_text: You did well out there. You've got something, Liang. Potential, yeah? Liang nods.

direction.raw_text: Don't spend it all in once place.

direction.raw_text: Billy comes down a back ally and knocks on a door. After a moment the door opens. The Doorman recognises him and lets him enter.

direction.raw_text: with Billy as he makes his way through the small subterranean nightclub. A Thai man - known as The Lizard - sits by a table with a few locals gambling... He spots Billy and follows him with his eyes as he continues to gamble. Billy moves across to a small private corner... ... where he meets various men and women, all smoking Methamphetamine. Billy joins in but an argument quickly starts up between him and another Thai Man. The music's too loud to hear what they're arguing about but it suddenly gets out of control... Billy starts viciously hitting the Thai Man and quickly the room EXPLODES in a frenzy of violence.

direction.raw_text: A fan does what it can to cool Julian down as he counts out money at his desk. Sitting opposite him, feet on the table, is Gordon, Julian's lieutenant and the closest thing to a friend he's got... Julian's phone rings. He interrupts his counting. Picks up and listens...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on, hold on. What did he say? Beat as Julian listens. He glances over at Gordon who looks up, concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ON THE PHONE) No, tell him to stay there. Tell them both to stay there. Beat.

direction.raw_text: (ON THE PHONE) I'm coming over.

direction.raw_text: He still in there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... No. Beat... Julian glances at Gordon.

direction.raw_text: Well maybe you didn't try hard enough. The Lizard takes the handkerchief away from his nose. Shows the bloodstain to Julian.

direction.raw_text: When was the last time you slept? The Lizard smiles but stares at Julian with hatred in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just cause I ain't slept for three days, don't mean I don't know right from wrong... and your brother has become a real problem... Again Julian stares at him - clenching his fist. The Lizard notices this but gazes up into Julian's face blankly.

direction.raw_text: You're not going to cause another ruckus in my club now - are you? A long pause as Julian considers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.

direction.raw_text: Good - 'cause Billy ripped me off and then he broke my face... Julian turns to Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like I always said. One day he's going to meet the devil. Beat.

direction.raw_text: You know where he is now? The Lizard stares at Julian.

direction.raw_text: Bangkok has millions of people my friend. You and your brother, you're lost to my world... The Lizard gets up - puts out his cigarette and looks at Julian...

direction.raw_text: So what you going to do? You wanna come in? Very good amphetamine in here... Julian looks over to Gordon. Sees he's keen.

direction.raw_text: You go. I'm gonna look around. See if I can find him.

direction.raw_text: Sure--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on. He turns back to The Lizard.

direction.raw_text: Which way'd he go? The Lizard nods his head towards the busy street. Julian turns and heads off... Gordon steps up to the entrance to the club. The Lizard sticks out an arm, blocking his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His brother didn't pay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? That's his problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now it's your problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm with you mate. Billy's fucked--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't pay his debt - you don't enter. Gordon thinks for beat. Takes out his money...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much...? ...and The Lizard smiles for the first time.

direction.raw_text: Julian is talking to Ma Long, fifties, the mother figure to a group of girls who stand in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seen Billy?

direction.raw_text: Not this evening. A particularly pretty prostitute catches Juilan's eye. He stares at her, stone faced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well if he comes in, tell him I'm looking for him, yeah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not coming in. I tell him to stay away. He hurt one of my girls Julian. Not good... Julian considers. Pulls out his wad of notes again. Hands a few to Ma Long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well... if you see him, tell him I'm looking for him... Ma Long nods as she takes the money. Julian is about to leave. He looks at the pretty prostitute again. Stares at her for a moment. Then walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy's so wasted he's bumping into people. He starts window shopping the various brothels that line the street: groups of girls smiling at him... Anything for a price...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: one particularly young-looking girl. Just fifteen. She makes eye contact with Billy... He smiles... Pulls out a roll of notes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian out in the middle of the road. Girls on the pavement, girls in the windows. A steady line of punters cruising past. He stands alone. Focussed. Watchful. An island in a sea of neon. It feels ominous. Like something really bad's about to happen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON Chang, mid-forties, a man who looks like he's carved out of stone. The neon lights bleed over his face in a seemingly unending flow as he's driven towards his destination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police cars are parked up outside. Chang gets out of his taxi. Pays the driver. Makes his way inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang makes his way up the stairs to a landing where a GROUP OF POLICEMEN are gathered. Their circle opens up as Chang approaches and they bow as he joins them - like he's a God. One of the group, Kim Han Ho, gestures towards the door of Room 610 where TWO COPS stand guard. Chang gives a nod and the door is opened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang stands silhouetted in the doorway. Stepping into the room he moves into the light in CLOSE UP. His face is a mask. The bed is drenched in blood. The fifteen year old prostitute lies naked on her back. She's dead, her body having been savagely beaten in some sort of brutal sex game gone wrong. Billy is slumped in the corner in his underpants, his eyes glazed, staring at MTV, a bottle of Mehkong whiskey in his hand, a crack pipe on the floor. Chang stares at him, giving nothing away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Hotel Owner serves tea to Chang who sits in silence with Lieutenant Kim. The door is open and we can see into room 610 across the corridor where Billy is still sat staring at the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A young cop, Daeng, who has been watching Chang, summons up courage to whisper to his superior officer, Phaiban.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is that guy? Phaiban says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he a cop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was... Before Daeng can ask another questions, two more cops lead an older Thai man, Choi Yan Lee (50's, overweight, dragged straight from his bed) down the corridor towards the crime scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Choi Yan Lee is delivered to the doorway, Chang gets up and goes over to him. A moment of uncertainty in Choi Yan Lee's face. Fear. He doesn't know why he's been brought here. He looks for some comfort from Chang. Chang gives him nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang leads Choi Yan Lee to the doorway. Slowly Choi Yan Lee realises what he's looking at. His daughter. Dead. Mutilated. Every father's worst nightmare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this your daughter? Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you? ... but Choi Yan Lee just stares at his daughter. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... What?

direction.raw_text: How could you let this happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't do anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well now's your chance. A long moment between them as Choi Yan Lee fails to understand what Chang is suggesting. Chang stands back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what thou will. Choi Yan Lee nods. Chang leaves the room, closing the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang sits drinking tea in silence with Lieutenant Kim. The guards in the corridor stare at the closed door of Room 610 from where we hear the cries of Billy being beaten to death.

direction.raw_text: ON: Daeng who's starting to look scared. Phaiban puts a reassuring hand on his shoulder. As the beating reaches its climax, with Choi Yan Lee screaming out Thai obscenities, we hear the sickening sound of Billy's neck snapping. And then a regular thud as blow after blow rain down on his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang opens the door and looks through. Choi Yan Lee is sitting breathlessly on the floor covered in blood. In his hand he holds a piece of wood he has ripped from a chair. Billy lies dead, his head completely smashed in.

direction.raw_text: A police car drives through the city streets and onto the freeway heading out of town.

direction.raw_text: The bloodied Choi Yan Lee sits in the back, Chang on one side, Kim on the other. As the police car turns onto a more major road, Choi Yan Lee starts to get nervous.

direction.raw_text: You missed my turning. I live that way. Beat. Chang says nothing. Phaiban is driving, Daeng in the passenger seat. Daeng looks back at them through the rearview mirror...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get you there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Police Car heads over the Mega Bridge and continues its way out of town.

direction.raw_text: The bright white headlights of the stationary police car blind Choi Yan Lee who's caught in their glare, rigid with fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry. Please. Please. Please don't hurt me. I'm so sorry.

direction.raw_text: What are you sorry for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought... You were there. He killed my daughter. I thought you were letting me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Answer the question. What are you sorry for? Beat. Choi Yan Lee is wrongfooted. Tentatively...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I killed the Westerner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And why did you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He killed my daughter.

direction.raw_text: And why did he do that? Choi Yan Lee can't answer.

direction.raw_text: How old was she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew what she was doing and you did nothing.

direction.raw_text: (IN THAI) What did you expect me to do? You have to have pity on me. My daughter's just been murdered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't about her. This is about your other three daughters and making sure you don't forget them. Chang nods to Kim and Phaiban who grab hold of Choi Yan Lee. Kim slips a plastic strap around Choi Yan Lee's arm, using it as a tourniquet. They wrestle him to the ground and pull his arm out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't forget. I promise. Forgive me. Chang approaches with the axe. He stops for a moment. Looks down at him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (IN THAI) I'll change. I'll be a better man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Chang slams down the axe, severing Choi Yan Lee's arm at the elbow. Choi Yan Lee SCREAMS in agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The anonymity of a hotel room. Julian opens the curtains and we see the sky line of Bangkok - he looks out. He lies back on the bed, surfing through two hundred TV channels. Settles on a boxing match. Starts drifting off... As he drifts we hear the SOUND OF SINGING. A karaoke rendition of 'I Hung My Head' by Johnny Cash.

direction.raw_text: I set off running to wake from the dream My brother's rifle went into the sheen I kept on running Into the south lands That's where they found me My head in my hands

direction.raw_text: that the voice is that of Chang and he's not half bad either: deeper than you'd have though, and with it comes a stage presence, a sort of John Wayne swagger...

direction.raw_text: The sheriff he asked me Why I had run And then it came to me Just what I had done And all for no reason Just one piece of lead I hung my head I hung my head. The policemen, still dressed in their uniforms, watch in respectful silence. Daeng sits with them. He too watches in awe.

direction.raw_text: Chang travels home across the city.

direction.raw_text: Chang opens the door as quietly as he can. He slips off his shoes and walks gingerly into the apartment.

direction.raw_text: On the kitchen table Chang sees a picture. A badly-drawn house with a man, a woman and a child. Across the bottom: "LOVE YOU DADDY FROM DAUGHTER AND WIFE XXX' Chang stares at it and smiles - picks it up and pins it to the fridge with a magnet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang and Kanita, his eight year old daughter, are playing with her dolls who have captured a soft toy.

direction.raw_text: "And so the king and the fairies that lived in the village said to the creature: this is your mark which will stay with you forever. If you ever try and blow down our village again, it will heat up until it boils your brains, for it has magical properties. Go in peace. Kanita nods, happy with the judgement. She picks the soft toy up and 'walks' it away from the village of the dolls.

direction.raw_text: Chang walks into his bedroom where his wife Nadee is just waking up. He kisses her good morning. As he starts to undress, she starts to get dressed. They share a smile about this. Finally Chang lies down on the bed and closes his eyes. Nadee kisses him good night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nadee starts making breakfast as Kanita watches cartoons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Chang sleeps the heavy curtains are drawn to keep out the light of the day - but they cannot deaden the sound of the city outside as it goes about its frenetic everyday business. The CAMERA MOVES through the apartment, briefly settling on the sleeping Chang, then roaming through the various rooms, PICKING OUT different objects... We see that Chang is obsessed with cowboy films and a keen collector - the sitting room is stuffed with movie posters, photographs and other bits of movie memorabilia... Amongst the many family photos we also PICK OUT several pictures of Chang when he was in the army and shots of what looks like a very successful career as a Thai boxer. At the end of the tour we're back with Chang. We ZOOM IN to a tight CLOSE SHOT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see a hotel room door and hear a knock - Julian ENTERS FRAME and opens to reveal... ...Two Thai girls - one being Mai - standing in the hallway. Julian lets them enter. Mai embraces Julian, kissing him on the mouth as Julian closes the door. They turn to consider the other girl who is starting to undress. She smiles compliantly, eager to please. Julian turns back to Mai and kisses her again. As the kiss becomes more passionate, the other girl joins them and the three of them begin to have sex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang is sitting eating alone at the dinning table, watching an old western on TV.

direction.raw_text: Chang walks down the streets towards a school. Standing at the gate, Kanita is waiting for him. He hugs her and they hold hands as they continue down the crowded street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang waits patiently at the counter as Kanita sorts through various dolls, trying to choose which one to buy... Chang looks round and gazes out the window into the street where pedestrians stream past. Suddenly Chang has a strange VISION: All the women disappear. In the street there are only men. We cut to a CLOSE UP of Chang and then back to his VISION again: Now all the men have gone and he can see only women. Back to the CLOSE UP of Chang who continues staring out of the

direction.raw_text: ... where everything is back to normal. Men and women walking up and down the sidewalk.

There is a knock on the door. Julian and the girl ignore it. A pause and then Julian's mobile phone starts ringing. He doesn't answer. The knocking starts up again, this time louder. Finally:

direction.raw_text: Julian's not here mate. Fuck off... Beat - then we hear a voice from behind the door.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Julian? Still they ignore him. Either too wasted or too tired to do anything else.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) Julian...? I need to talk with you... Beat. Finally Julian answers with zero energy...

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) It's about Billy...

direction.raw_text: I can't deal with my brother right now... Beat.

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) He's dead... Julian opens his eyes, confused - still out of his head on drugs.

direction.raw_text: What? No answer. Finally Julian gets up and wraps a towel around his body and slowly opens the door. Gordon stands in the hallway - behind him two Thai men from Julian's crew.

direction.raw_text: What happened?

direction.raw_text: They found his body in a hotel room... Julian doesn't know what to say... Neither does Gordon.

He glances at the pretty girl still sleeping on the bed. He goes into the bathroom where Mai is dressed and putting on make up.

direction.raw_text: What happened? Julian looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone killed Billy... The camera ZOOMS IN on Mai.

direction.raw_text: Mortuary Attendant pulls a sheet back to reveal - Billy. His body completely mutilated. Julian stares at his brother's corpse intensely, not betraying any emotion. He turns to Gordon who's standing behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For now... We wait. Julian glances back at the body...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian stares up at the night sky, his mobile phone gripped tightly in his hand. He puts the phone down. He looks out across the city again then back to the phone. It's like he's scared. He picks it up quickly and dials. A moment as it rings then it's answered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Mum. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me... Julian... Something's happened.

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA tracks as we follow a pair of high heeled shoes belonging to an elegant woman in her fifties, who looks like she's in her forties and could actually pass for late thirties. She strides towards reception, a Porter struggling to keep up with her. This is Jenna Hopkins. Head of a notorious London Crime Family. Mother of both Julian and Billy. Newly appointed Lady Macbeth of Bangkok. She hands her passport over to the Concierge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like to check in now please. The Concierge checks the computer.

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid the room won't be ready until four o'clock. Beat... Jenna just stares at him...

direction.raw_text: ... It's policy

direction.raw_text: Yes of course... The Concierge retreats. Jenna lights a cigarette.

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon madam, what seems to be the problem?

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry madam...

direction.raw_text: ...Fuck off you cunt, just hand me the fucking key... She lays the money on the desk. The manager looks around...

direction.raw_text: Well I might be able to arrange something... The Manager turns to the Concierge.

direction.raw_text: Put it in your pocket.

direction.raw_text: There's really no need--

direction.raw_text: Put it in your fucking pocket. The Manager takes the money. Pockets it. Places the key on the desk.

direction.raw_text: Room 300.

direction.raw_text: The struggling Porter opens the door and lets Jenna in. She walks into the suite and gives it the once over. Satisfactory. The Porter places her bags on the side and hangs up some of her clothes, desperate to try and get out in one piece... As soon as he's finished he bows and starts to shuffle out of the room.

direction.raw_text: Hey... Open this. Jenna points to the Duty Free bag then starts running a bath, beginning to undress.

direction.raw_text: I need a drink. The Porter is stunned.

direction.raw_text: Well don't just stand there... The Porter fumbles, taking the gin out of the Duty Free bag, spilling the tonic in his nervousness as he makes her cocktail. Jenna returns in a dressing gown, takes the drink off him and takes a huge slug. The Porter is terrified, stunned. Rooted to the spot. Jenna sits on the bed and stares out of the window. Just as the Porter thinks it's safe to try edging out of the room again, she starts talking to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I loved him so much you know... Billy... Beat. The Porter doesn't know what the fuck she's talking about.

direction.raw_text: Everyone loves their children don't they? Well, not everyone, but... She looks over at him. The Porter smiles at her.

direction.raw_text: Do you want to see a picture? The Porter nods, uncertain. Jenna gets up, goes over to her purse. Opens it up. A picture of Billy. She hands it to the Porter - who takes it and just looks at it, not knowing what to do... Jenna starts to cry. For a long time. Finally...

direction.raw_text: Madam. I have to return to my station. Jenna snaps out of it in an instant.

direction.raw_text: What, yeah, thanks. She pulls a fifty dollar bill out of her purse. She hands the money to the Porter who leaves as quickly as he dares.

direction.raw_text: . We hear Dave Berry singing 'Mama'.

direction.raw_text: The elevator doors open. Julian steps out into the empty hallway. Everything is normal... But everything is also not normal. The CAMERA tracks from behind as Julian walks - looking at the doors as he passes them and finally stopping in front of one: He knocks but there is no answer. Realizing the door isn't locked, he pushes it open and steps in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is exactly the same as the one Jenna's staying in. However, instead of her, Julian sees a man sitting on the bed, his back to him. His features are obscured... Julian slowly begins to walk towards him, but before he can reach out, the figure turns to face him... It's Chang. But there is blood smeared all over his face... Julian stares at him in horror. Slowly he looks down at his hands only to discover that they're dripping in blood... We ZOOM IN on his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian wakes from his nightmare - covered in sweat. He is alone. He sits up. Looks at his hands, still very shaken by his nightmare... We hear the traffic of Bangkok. Julian gets up and walks to the table... Light up and begins to smoke morphine... He walks to the window and looks out over Bangkok... His phone rings - Julian answers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) It's me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi Mum. Where are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I'm in Bangkok...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Julian looks at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ON THE PHONE) ... I thought you didn't get in til midnight...? Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I needed to be by myself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... so, what d'you want to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Raise Hell... Julian turns his back to the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenna looks immaculate. She stubs out her cigarette when she spots Julian making his way towards her. She gets up and they embrace. She holds on to him. A little too long. Finally she pulls away. She looks at him for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could it be have been one of the gangs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. Take your pick. Billy wasn't popular.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Billy... He was eccentric. Jenna smiles to herself as if this brings back memories and Julian even smiles. Both sit in silence for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you're going to find out who did it, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll make sure it gets done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it needs to be you that does it. We need to show them. Do you understand what I'm saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, okay, I'll do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian as we bring up the SOUND of Johnny Cash's Ring of Fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love is a burning thing And it makes a firey ring Bound by wild desire I fell into a ring of fire
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang is singing again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fell into a burning ring of fire I went down, down, down And the flames went higher And it burns, burns, burns The Ring of Fire / The Ring of Fire And the cops are all there, Daeng included, watching him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang's singing continues as we see an assortment of tough looking Thai Men listening to Gordon (MUTE).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ` (V.O.) I fell into a burning ring of fire I went down, down, down And the flames went higher And it burns, burns, burns The Ring of Fire / The Ring of Fire Gordon explains the situation: what information they're after, how much they'll get paid for good leads. All the while Julian watches from the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A montage of Julian's crew spreading out, shaking down their various contacts: doormen, pimps, dirty cops, stall holders, barmen...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The taste of love is sweet When hearts like ours meet I fell for you like a child Oh, but the fire went wild. One of the crew, the rat faced Charlie Ling, starts talking to the Hotel Owner who was there the night of the murder. A couple of hundred Bhat notes and he starts talking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang reaches the climax of the song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I fell into a burning ring of fire I went down, down, down And the flames went higher And it burns, burns, burns The Ring of Fire / The Ring of Fire The Cops watch with total devotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tuck-tuck makes its way through the crowded streets driven by one of Choi Yan Lee's Three Daughter's. In the back sits Choi Yan Lee, his stump of an arm in a sling, a daughter either side of him. His arm's only just been bandaged up and he's clearly still in a lot of pain, his face going into spasm with every bump in the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian stands on the street corner sipping a soft drink. Waiting. Behind him Gordon, his phone glued to his face. On the other side of the road is Choi Yan Lee's Kiosk, big enough to double as his home, currently manned by his long suffering wife Kim Yan Lee. She serves a chilled coconut to a man. As he turns round we reveal... he's a particularly murderous looking member of Julian's crew - Ko Sam. We pick out Charlie Ling a little further down the road, who's looking at a tray of battery powered robots that some Street Kid's selling. They're all counting down the minutes. Biding their time. Waiting for Choi Yan Lee to turn up. Finally the sound of the Tuck-tuck approaching... Ko Sam drinks his coconut down in one - slurping as he hits the bottom. Letting the empty shell fall to the floor. Charlie Ling stands up. Feels the gun under his jacket. The Tuck-tuck pulls up and Choi Yan Lee's Daughters help him into the kiosk that doubles as their home. Julian and his men close in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Choi Yan Lee enters his home and his daughters make a fuss of him, the shutters of the kiosk counter are suddenly SLAMMED SHUT. They all turn round in panic, but before they can do anything about it, the last of the three daughters is pushed into the kiosk, followed by Ko Sam, Charlie Ling, Gordon and Julian. Choi Yan Lee snivels in the corner, waving his bandaged arm in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't kill me. I'm a cripple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you? What do you think you're doing? Get out or we'll call the police. Ko Sam shakes his head at her. Not a good idea. Julian turns to Charlie Ling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask him if he's Choi Yan Lee. At the mention of his name the colour drains from Choi Yan Lee's face. His eyes lock with Julian's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is your name Choi Yan Lee? Choi Yan Lee nods his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask him why he killed my brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed his brother. Big mistake fat man. Why'd you do it? Beat. Choi Yan Lee knows he's been caught...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He murdered my daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says he killed his daughter. Julian considers him for a moment. Slowly he pulls out a gun... Aims it at Choi Yan Lee's face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God. Please don't kill me. Please. I'll give you anything. Anything you want. My daughters. My shop. Please. I've paid for what I did. Look at me. In his desperation Choi Yan Lee suddenly lurches forward, brandishing his wounded arm at Julian. He pulls the bandages off, exposing the bloody stump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (IN THAI) I've paid for what I did. Don't you see? Julian turns to Charlie Ling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he saying? Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says... He says he's paid for what he's done. That he's been punished already. Choi Yan Lee nods his head enthusiastically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He told me to do it. Then he took my hand. Look. Again he thrusts his stump at Julian who glances at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who did that to him? Choi Yan Lee looks at the various faces that surround him - then stares directly at Julian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Angel of Vengeance... Charlie Ling looks at him surprised... yet there's a sense that deep down he knows what he's talking about...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a lie - he doesn't exist...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling the truth. It was the Angel of Vengeance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's lying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a story old women tell their grand children... 'The Angel of Vengeance' is supposed to come down from the heavens and judge the living... restore karma to the world.. Gordon laughs... but Julian listens with great interest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does he do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leads people to their destiny... That's the myth anyway. Ko Sam smiles. Julian doesn't. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask him who cut his hand off. Charlie Ling's reluctant to question him further. Julian insists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who turned you into a cripple - and no bullshit this time. Choi Yan Lee continues babbling hysterically...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you the truth... The Angel of Vengeance is real... He made me do it... You've got to believe me... I've already been judged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says it was The Angel of Vengeance... Choi Yan Lee starts to giggle uncontrollably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Angel of Vengeance. Yes. You don't find the Angel of Vengeance. No. He finds you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull yourself together fat man. If you don't talk sense I'll cut off your cock and shove it down your throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm telling you the truth. He'll find you. Choi Yan Lee retreats to the corner of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he say? Charlie Ling considers Choi Yan Lee. Realizes he's not going to get a better answer out of him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said you don't find The Angel of Vengeance. He finds you... Julian considers this for a long time. He realises he's not pointing his gun anymore. Puts it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we going to kill him or what? The room suddenly feels stuffy. The atmosphere oppressive. Julian's got to get out...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? But Julian's already stumbling out of the kiosk...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing... We're not going to do anything... Just leave him. Leave them all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian stumbles out of the kiosk and breaths in lungfulls of air. Disoriented, he careers into a stall selling various religious artefacts, sending candles, incense and statues of Buddha flying... He falls to the ground. When he gets to his feet everything around him seems intense and incredibly vibrant... The dogs fighting on the street, the Buddha that lies in pieces on the ground, the children that stand watching him, his crew as they come out of the kiosk, hiding their guns... Julian takes a long moment to get his bearings... Finally he stands up, but as he does he feels different... As if the axis of his world has shifted...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA TRACKS from the side as we see Jenna walk through the boxing gym. All around her people are fighting and sparring. She spots Julian and Gordon through the large windows of the office. They see her and stand up. We LINGER OUTSIDE in the training area as Jenna goes through THE DOOR...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boxers train in the background. Jenna, Julian and Gordon sit in silence. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you kill him? Beat. A shared look between Gordon and Julian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a little bit more complicated than that Mum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Complicated? He killed my son... What's so fucking complicated about that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mum, calm down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tell me to calm down. I want him dead. Beat... Julian does not know how to explain the situation. Jenna stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't forgive. Only God does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, you always say that - but this is different...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How? Silence. Julian doesn't know how to answer. Jenna watches him carefully...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe... Maybe Billy had it coming...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...because of what he did. Jenna thinks it over for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just don't - some Thai cunt murdered your brother and we're not going to let him get away with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if... What if it was The Angel of Vengeance? Jenna stares at her son like he's finally lost the plot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Angel of fucking what...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...it - or he - restores karma and order in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Restores' things? Who said anything about 'restoring' things? Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loves all humans...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what kind of spiritual journey you're on, but you will kill
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not, I'm just... Julian can't get the words out. He gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I've got to go. ...and Julian leaves - letting the door to the office stay open. We pick up the sounds of the fighters training outside as we slowly
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: IN on Jenna. She turns to Gordon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's business?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright, yeah. Well, what with Billy not being around, it's tricky to be honest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What d'you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're supposed to be moving five keys out the end of this week. But Billy's not here, is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here. Julian's here. Gordon shrugs. Jenna clocks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's gotten into him...? Is he high or something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Earlier today - we had the guy... The guy that killed Billy. Had a gun against his face. But then - nothing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian let him go. Now there's all this stuff about angels... I don't know what the fuck's wrong with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not like you... Gordon smiles at her uncertainly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know how to do what needs to be done. That's all. She stares at him, long enough to make him uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So tell me... What did he mean when he said it was complicated?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's this other guy... Might have been involved...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we kill them both.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know who the other guy is yet...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Well how about we start with the guy we do know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A girl sings 'Another Woman's Man' by Dolly Parton. Julian's sitting alone at a table, nursing a drink. Mai enters, looking much more sophisticated than when we saw her in the hotel. She sits next to Julian and gives him a kiss on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry I'm late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright... He drinks his drink. Silence...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Mai looks around the bar... It's half empty - some girls and men spread out. The waitress comes over and Mai orders a drink. They sit in silence, listening to the song...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See anyone you want us to take home tonight? Julian glances round but shakes his head. Looks at Mai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's with you? You want to get high? Beat. Silence. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to meet my Mum. A pause, Mai slightly taken about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she here? Julian nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D'you want me to? Julian nods. Mai studies him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why d'you want me to meet her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To show her... To show that I've got something here...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, like we're a couple? Julian stares at her for a long time. Can't quite say it out loud, but the answer's yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Choi Yan Lee oversees his daughter's serving hot food to customers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liang, the young kick boxer, watching him from across the street. Liang pulls out a knife which glints in the light of the street lamps. He heads over to the shack. Liang asks Choi Yan Lee a question. Choi Yan Lee leans over to hear him better. Liang GRABS hold of his hair and PULLS him over the counter, SLITTING his throat with the knife. Choi Yan Lee's wife and daughters look on as blood floods from his neck, over the sweets and snacks on sale and down to the ground below. Life slips away from Choi Yan Lee in a matter of seconds. Liang holds onto him until he's dead and then lets go of his head and runs off into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon is waiting on a street corner smoking cigarettes. Liang comes up to him, breathless. Gordon pulls out several hundred dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never come back - you understand me? Liang nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good... Liang takes the money. A proper pay out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a fighter, kid. No doubt about it. Good luck with that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian's talking to Liang's Mother and Sister who are sitting in front of him, both upset. Gordon hovers in the background...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did you last see him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last night. He went out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he have any enemies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone called him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone called his mobile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't know. They spoke in English. Liang's Mother pulls out a mobile phone. Passes it to Julian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This his phone? Liang's Sister nods. Julian scrolls through the numbers. All have Thai names against them - except one. Julian considers the number, then redials. A beat. Then the SOUND of a phone ringing in the same room. Gordon looks round. Realises he's busted. Takes his phone out. Kills it. Julian stares at him. Before he gets a chance to say anything, there is a knock on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) There's some cops here to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do they want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Probably just money. You want me to find out how much? Julian thinks it over...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'll talk to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian clocks the cops who are waiting for him. He walks over, strangely on edge. As he gets closer he sees Chang - standing on the other side of the room by the boxing ring, his back to him, watching the sparring fighters... Julian stares at him... Turns back to the cops...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning officers. How can I help you? Slowly Chang turns to face him. Julian stares at him as if he's in a trance...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're investigating the murder of Choi Yan Lee. Julian recovers. Turns to Kim and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never heard of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His arm was cut off. Here. Julian manages to cover his reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I run a boxing club. Not much call for one armed men. A beat. Mexican stand off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this got to do with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was the father of the girl that was found dead with your brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I guess you boys have got a lot of work to do - so have I, so if you'll excuse me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why we're here Mr Hopkins. If you could just answer our questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, sorry. What do you want to know? Julian looks over to Chang who continues staring at the boxers. The way the ring is lit he's almost silhouetted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where were you last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With my mum... Some of the boxers come over to Chang. They know him. They're reverential. With the effect of the lighting, it seems to Julian like they're bowing down before a God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to speak to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That wont be necessary at the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I suspect? Chang turns round to face Julian. His presence is magnetic. Julian stares back at him, realizing that this must be the Angel of Vengeance... Chang walks over to them. Studies Julian for a long moment and then turns to Kim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not the man. And as soon as he's said it, he turns on his heel and leaves. The cops back off and away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: IN on Julian. Deflated and strangely disappointed... He turns to Gordon who's standing behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to find out who that guy is. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. No problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now. The SOUND of Nadee singing 'LONELY COMING DOWN' by Dolly Parton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang sits on his own drinking apple juice as he watches his wife sing on stage. Julian enters, sees Chang but can only see the back of his face. He walks over to the bar, orders a drink. Julian starts to watch Nadee. When he turns back to the bar he sees Chang reflected in the optics - somehow standing right next to him, staring at him. Julian turns to face him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're him... Aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one who killed my brother. Chang says nothing for a long time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love all living things. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I restore karma. Is that why you came?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came here to kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's stopping you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like me to tell you? Julian nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want the Angel of Vengeance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cause, all my life... I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother wants me to kill you. Chang stares back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I love violence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to fight me? Julian nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thai style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three cops sit eating noodles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about his brain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a risk... One hit in the wrong place and he'll be straight back in hospital. And maybe he wont be so lucky as last time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why's he going to fight the Westerner? The question hangs in the air. It's what they're all wondering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He used to be a great boxer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has to do it. Since he came out of the coma, that's what he's done. Whatever's been asked of him, he's done it. He can't help it. It's all a mystery... A mutual pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if he loses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't lose. He's the Angel of Vengeance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nadee is standing behind Chang. They're playing a game in which they speak in English. She points out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: View.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Window. `She points at the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you like the table?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. I like the table. Chang stiffens. Nadee detects the change in him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? Chang takes her in his arms. He starts kissing her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to speak to you in Thai. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you. She stares at him for a long moment. It's odd for him to have confessed his feelings in such a way. Not bad, just odd. And then she starts to kiss him back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian is anxiously waiting outside. He looks up as Mai comes out of her appartment in a red dress. Julian's face drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't wear that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother's... Very particular about colours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're kidding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hates red. Come on, we'll get you something else. Mai stares at him, reluctant to give in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'm telling you. It's easier this way. Trust me. Mai gives in. Takes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang picks out a dress for Mai. She takes it, finding it hard to believe that he's making her do this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three people sit around a table awkwardly. Julian, Jenna and Mai (dressed very conservatively) all eating soup. A long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... May, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Mai, Mum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long have you two known each other then? Mai's about to answer but Juilan gets there first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A year and a half isn't it? Beat as Mai quickly counts in her head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...that sounds about right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it's always a rare treat to meet one of Julian's lady friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mum, please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, where did you two meet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw her walking down the street. Jenna raises an eyebrow...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I thought - this is the most beautiful girl I've ever seen - so I just walked up to her and started talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear that happens a lot in this part of the world... Tell me, what's your line of work, Mai?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I work in the service industry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet you do. But tell me Mai, before you started serving my son, how many cocks were you serving? Was it over a thousand? Mai stares at Jenna in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know girls like you. Just because you might be pulling the wool over my son's eyes don't think it's going to work with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mum, stop it, for fuck's sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry Julian, but I won't stand by and let a dirty little hooker take advantage of my son in the vain hope that her womb isn't so diseased that she can trick him into impregnating her and putting another cocksucking child on to this earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave her alone Mum. You've got her wrong. She's a good girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you know about what's good? Beat. Julian says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's good to me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that's nice isn't it, I'm really happy for you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mum! A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cops came by my club today. Beat. She stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're investigating a murder. The guy that killed Billy turned up dead this morning. Jenna looks bored. Lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh really, shame that, still, live by the sword, die by the sword...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know it was you, Mum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did what had to be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was there. He was with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Angel of Vengeance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D'you kill him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cause he as good as killed Billy. What I want to know is, what are you going to do about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to kill him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you are. You're going to do it for me and you're going to do it for your brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't about Billy. This is about me. All my life I've been running...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right you cunt, cause you always run away whenever there's a problem... just like you're running away from killing this fucking Angel of whatever -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - his name is Chang-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang?! Mai stands up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be going now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down you cunt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mum, don't talk to her like that. Mai sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what am I left with? Julian stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me. Jenna calms down. She looks at their reflections in the mirror behind the bar. We ZOOM in on the mirror, their faces refracted by the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. We're family. We stick together. But Billy was family too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy was a fuck up... He deserved everything he got. You know it and I know it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it. I'm not listening to this. I don't ever want to hear you mention his name again... Do you hear me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah we were brothers, but we were never close... And he was only in Bangkok cause you couldn't control him. So you sent him to me--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- So you sent him to me and what could I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could have protected him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did what I could. And that's more than you ever did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would've done anything for him. Okay, he wasn't born with as many advantages as you were. He struggled with things. But I always stood by him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what did that get him? I'll tell you what, a one way ticket to this fucking place, just like me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you dare blame me for what happened back then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only here 'cause of you. If you didn't exist, I wouldn't be here. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could've been someone, Mum. I was on my way... Jenna stares at him - this is a conversation she does not like having...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You would've been a great fighter... You could've gone pro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think I know that? And look at me now. I'm a front for a drugs smuggling. He turns to Mai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's true... The whole thing's a front. Every day I see kids coming in with great potential. And every day I see kilos of heroin going out. And it's all because of you, Ma. You and the money and the drugs. Jenna silently seethes, waiting for Julian to shut the fuck up. He quietens down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least you're not behind bars and that's more important to me. Julian turns to her - he has been waiting all his life to say this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right Mum. That's what's more important to you. But what about me? Sometimes I think you only got me out of there so the cops couldn't trace it back to you... Jenna stares at him. Her face a mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...that's right Mum. Think about it. With me gone you were safe. And it turned out to be good for business as well. All very convenient. Silence between them. Jenna lights another cigarette - her hands now shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what happened with Billy? Did Billy become a problem like I did? Wouldn't surprise me, he was a big fucking problem when he was here... Still, at least you didn't have him killed. Jenna slaps him hard on the face. Julian recovers. Looks up at her. Very intense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to kill him for you, Mum. Doesn't matter what you say. And do you want to know why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surprise me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause I'm going to fight him. In the ring. Me versus him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that seems sensible... And what do you hope that's going to achieve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't expect you to understand. Cause you don't understand anything that isn't about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And when you lose, what's going to happen then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... But maybe this time I'll win. Like you say, only God forgives. Maybe this time he'll forgive me... Jenna turns to Mai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you understand what he's talking about? 'Cause I haven't got a fucking a clue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never did, Mum. A pause. Julian's touched a nerve. Jenna recovers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you find what you're looking for. 'Cause if you don't, it's going to find you and I'm not always going to be there to look after you. Jenna composes herself. Suddenly brightens. A different person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice to meet you Mai. Hope to see you again soon. Jenna shakes her hand. Mai's too shocked to resist. And then, as if nothing had happened, Jenna leaves. Julian covers his face with his napkin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright? He's not. He's crying. But he doesn't want anyone to see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be fine. In a minute. Julian wipes his face clean. Pulls himself together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jenna gets out of her cab and walks toward reception, a look of steely determination in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Concierge and the Manager see Jenna coming towards them and brace themselves... However, to their relief, she diverts to the palm court area where Gordon is waiting for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice evening?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lovely, yeah. Just catching up, you know. Jenna sits down. Lights a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a piece of work, aren't you? Gordon blushes. Jenna blows out her match.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No fucking hanging about with you, is there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I don't know about that. Just been out here a while... Know how to get things done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But things are going to shit. Since Billy died, Julian's all over the place...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll have to something about that the, wont we? But, first things first, what about Chang?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My son's guardian angel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's just a retired cop...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, then he won't be to hard to kill, will he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not that simple... Is there somewhere we can go that's a little more private? Beat. She raises her eyebrows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you have in mind? Gordon blushes. Moves closer, conspiratorial...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't just going round killing cops here anymore. It's not that easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say it was easy. But then, you're a resourceful man, aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I looked into it. Chang's a hard man to get to. None of the Thais'll go near him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then you're going to have to find someone who's not a fucking Thai then, aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There might be a way... But Julian can't find out... Jenna looks at Gordon - smiles and crosses her legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you worry about that. There are certain things that a mother and son shouldn't - and don't - discuss... Gordon thinks he does but isn't a hundred per cent sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Julian sits on a chair, holding his hand over a flame. Mai finishes applying make up, comes out of the bathroom wearing her red dress. She watches him for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seeing when it hurts. Mai watches him. He doesn't flinch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to go. Julian takes his hand off the flame. Sees she's left the clothes he bought her behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you like what I got you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's fine, but you know... It's not my style.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you should give it to your mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't to be so hard on her. Her life hasn't been easy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Julian. She's a fucking bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say that, okay? You don't know what you're talking about. She'd do anything for me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The way she talks to you -- JULIAN Don't go there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? 'Don't talk about my mother'? Come on Julian. Julian stands up, angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you fuck her instead of me? Julian grabs hold her neck. Throws her hard against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't get to judge her. You think she's bad? You should've met my dad. But he's not around anymore, and do you know why? Cause she loved me too much. He lets go of her neck. Mai rubs her neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're fucked. He pulls money out of his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much do I owe you? He forces a roll of notes into her hand, forcing her to take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you. She opens the door, sets fire to the money, and walks out of the room. As she walks down the hotel corridor, Julian slams his fists into the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mixed clientele. High class. Asian and European. But there's an edge to the atmosphere. The music's that bit too loud, that bit too aggressive. And the people inside don't look like they're having a good time. It seems evil. Sleazy. Jenna introduces herself to Yuri Karkov, a well dressed and charismatic Russian in his forties who is surrounded by Thai girls and fellow Russians including his distinctive looking bodyguard, Dimitri. As the camera TRACKS CLOSER to them we start to hear what they're saying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... so why do you want to kill a policeman? Policemen are good. They mind their own business and keep the streets safe. Stop people stealing my cars...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really want to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. It may effect the price.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He killed my son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revenge. Pricey...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Bangkok. Nothing's that expensive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. Most things are cheap in Bangkok. Especially life... We'll take care of this business for you. But it won't be easy and it won't be cheap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang and his crew eat dinner together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A crappy van pulls up outside. Out get three Cambodian men. Very poor, badly clothed. They look like farmers. Only they pull out semi automatic firearms and head for the restaurant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang has just finished a meal with the Cops including Kim, Daeng and Phaiban. Chang is just settling the bill when the Three Gunmen walk in. He looks up just as they OPEN FIRE. An insane storm of led rains down on the room, shattering all the mirrors on the back wall, taking out Two Waitresses and covering the room with broken glass. Chang hits the floor and starts to drag himself towards some cover. Chang's men are completely pinned down. Phaiban's been hit and his white shirt has turned dark red with blood. Chang keeps edging towards where his jacket's hanging on a chair. In it, his pistol. The Gunmen keep firing. As soon as a clip is finished, they pull it out and put a fresh one in and keep shooting. A stray bullet hits the waiter who knocks over the chair Chang's jacket's on. It falls to the ground. With it, his pistol. He grabs it and returns fire, letting off four rounds. He takes Gunman One. Head shot, right between the eyes. Gunman Two sees this and sprays at Chang - - but Chang manages to dive to cover. He rolls and fires again, shooting Gunman Two in the chest three times. Chang's out of ammo and needs to reload. Gunman Three's weapon jams. He drops his weapon and runs. Before he's finished reloading his pistol, Chang's after him. He sees Phaiban. Dead. Daeng trying to stem the flow of blood from his chest. Chang keeps running, determined not to lose his man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The driver of the crappy van smokes nervously in the driving seat as he waits. As soon as he sees Gunman Three, panic-stricken, running in fear, he puts the van in gear, revs the engine and starts to pull away. Gunman Three runs after him, crying out for him to slow down. The Driver slows. Gunman Three struggles to jump into the open doors. Chang bursts out of the restaurant. Stops dead. Aims and fires off two rounds. Blood spatters across the inside of the windscreen. The Driver falls forward, dead. The back door of the van slams shut. Gunman Three thinks he's made it. He's wrong. The van isn't going anywhere. Chang approaches the back door of the van, ready to fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want to die? Do you want me to kill you? For what you've done? A long pause. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (IN THAI) No. Please. Don't kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me why not. Tell me why I shouldn't shoot you as soon as you come out of that door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (IN THAI) I'm sorry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not good enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (IN THAI) It's my first time. I've never done anything like this before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that. You're wearing sandals. Hitmen don't wear sandals. The door opens. Sandaled feet step out of the van. Gunman Three comes out with his hands up, falling to his knees. Chang continues to point his weapon at the unarmed man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me a reason. The Cops appear behind him in the doorway. Chang holds his ground. His finger twitches. It looks like he's going to pull the trigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm begging you. Please--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You showed no mercy in there. Why should mercy be shown to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do. A long beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know his name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you know where he is. Gunman Three looks up... Nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flanked by the Cops, Chang frog marches Gunman Three through the crowds, passing various stalls that seem to sell anything you could ever want for your TV, computer or Hi-fi. Gunman Three is so scared that he keeps forgetting the route and fretting about which way to turn at every junction in the warren-like market. Finally they reach the entrance to a particular shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chang enters, followed by the others. Gunman Three is incredibly relieved to have found it. Li Po stands behind the counter - beside him sits Pan, a twelve year old boy who is severely handicapped. As soon as Li Po sees Chang and his crew arrive with Gunman Three next to them he knows the game's up. He can't run. His kid's sitting there... He approaches them with a heavy sigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know why we're here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He set it up. He knows who ordered the hit. He'll tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk unless I ask you to. Understood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Completely understood. Chang turns to Li Po.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have anything to say for yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a salesman. Some of the things I sell aren't exactly legal... But I'll give you the man that hired the hit... Chang stares at him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good... Li Po summons the contact details on his distinctive looking mobile phone. Proffers it to Chang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As for myself, I'm not scared of paying for what I've done. I just... just don't hurt my son. Chang looks down at Pan - who is just staring at them, not understanding the situation. Chang takes the phone from Li Po.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see? He knows. He's got the details. I told you he would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I told you not to talk unless I asked you. Chang aims his gun at Gunman Three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. You said if I took you to him you'd let me live. Chang shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never said that. Chang fires. Gunman Three's brains spatter across the TV screens on the far side of the wall. Pan begins to cry and Li Po hugs him and tells him how much he loves him... thinking they're next... Chang studies the mobile phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This him? Li Po nods - scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do I find him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skylight bar at the Jupiter.. Every night. Chang studies Li Po making sure he speaks the truth... then nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking your phone. Chang turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about me? Beat. Chang considers. Looks at Pan who's staring at Chang in fear. Looks back at Li Po.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forgive you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A people carrier pulls up outside the hotel. The doormen open the side door and step back when they see the heavily armed and bloodstained policemen get out, led by Chang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dimitri and the group of Russian Criminals. Yuri Karkov is in the centre of them, a girl on either arm. Chang leads the Cops into the bar. He fires two shots into the ceiling. That shuts everyone up and gets the Russian Criminals up and ready for a confrontation. Half the bar's emptied by the time Chang reaches Yuri Karkov.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better have a fucking good reason for doing this. Don't you know who you're fucking with. Chang looks at him.
direction.name: direction
